item.title: Russian region of Dagestan holds a day of mourning after attacks kill 20 people, officials say
Israeli defense minister vows hostage efforts in US talks
'Appalled': Joe Biden condemns 'antisemitic' protest outside LA Synagogue
item.description: ​“I’m appalled by the scenes outside of Adas Torah synagogue in Los Angeles,” Biden said in post on social media site X. “Intimidating Jewish congregants is dangerous, unconscionable, antisemitic, and un-American.” Fighting between pro-Palestinian demonstrators and counterprotesters erupted Sunday outside the Adas Torah synagogue in the heavily Jewish Pico-Robertson neighborhood and police were called in to break it up. In a statement, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass said the violence was “abhorrent” and that blocking access to a place of worship was unacceptable.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada stops post-graduate work permit for foreigners at port entry
item.description: Flagpoling is a legal practice but it is takes officers on both sides of the border away from their crucial role in protecting the safety, security and prosperity of Canadians and Americans. The Immigration Refugees and Citizenship Canada announced that it has banned post-graduate work permit for foreign nationals at the Canadian border.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Muted mics, no props: List of new rules for 1st Biden, Trump debate
item.description: There will be no live studio audience to react to the debate -- in a stark departure from the tradition. This is to ensure that the candidates may maximize the time allotted in the debate. Candidates will have two minutes to answer questions. No props or pre-written notes will be allowed on the stage. Candidates will be given a pen, a pad of paper and a bottle of water. Trump's campaign chose the order of closing statements that he will speak last. Biden will give his concluding statement first.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3.5 magnitude earthquake hits Los Angeles
item.description: Residents in Los Angeles were startled by a 3.2 magnitude earthquake near Highland Park. No significant damage was reported, and authorities reminded the public to be prepared for aftershocks, future tremors, safety measures, and authorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hawk tuah' girl was not fired after viral meme. Her real name is...
item.description: If 'Hawk tuah' was not hilarious enough, a satire page now claimed she was fired from Epstein Day School after her 'hawk tuah' went viral because her students started spitting on each other. Social media users were naive enough to believe in the satirical article while the 'hawk tuah' trend continues to soar.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Video of Trump spokesperson 'cut off' on air by CNN viral
item.description: ​Karoline Leavitt, the spokesperson of Donald Trump's campaign, was abruptly cut on a CNN show and the video has gone viral. This came days before CNN is set to host the first presidential debate between Joe Biden and Donald Trump. Karoline shared X posts condemning how she was cut off in the middle. Karoline and CNN anchor Kasie Hunt took their debate on X thereafter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Obama fundraiser says she will vote for Trump. Explains 'divorce'
item.description: Allison Huynh, a former fundraiser for Barack Obama, said she will be voting for Republican presumptive presidential candidate Donald Trump for the first time -- divorcing the Democratic Party. After years of supporting the Democrats, she said Joe Biden is asleep at the wheel while she now finds Donald Trump as knowledgeable, funny and intelligent. ​“I was happy with how knowledgeable Trump is about what is going on with the country and the economy. ,He had the information,” she said
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Britain Royal family: Princess Anne hospitalised after sustaining minor injuries
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Tadpole-shaped object': SpaceX rocket surprises music festival attendees with unusual sight
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Panic at 40,000 feet: Virgin Atlantic flight's cockpit windscreen cracks, makes emergency turnaround
item.description: A Virgin Atlantic flight from London to San Francisco turned back mid-flight after a cockpit windscreen crack at 40,000 feet between Greenland and Iceland. The exact cause remains unknown, ruling out a bird strike, as the cockpit windscreen is made up of multiple layers. A Virgin spokesperson assured passengers of safety amidst cabin decompression concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Extreme rollercoaster': Flyers suffer nosebleeds, ear pain after cabin pressure malfunctions
item.description: A Korean Air Boeing 737 MAX 8 experienced a pressurization malfunction after takeoff from Incheon Airport, causing discomfort and minor injuries like nosebleeds, ear pain, and hyperventilation. The incident occurred on a flight to Taichung, Taiwan, with a rapid descent over Jeju Island, inducing G-force-like experiences. Passengers received assistance and an alternate flight after the emergency landing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Korea factory fire: 20 dead bodies found at burned battery plant in Seoul
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel winding down Gaza operations as focus shifts to Hezbollah
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel's military will now focus on redeploying troops to the country's northern region, where tensions with Hezbollah have intensified. Additionally, residents who were forced to leave their homes will be allowed to return. "If we can, we'll do this by diplomatic means, if not it'll be achieved in another way," Netanyahu said, reflecting the growing tensions between Israel and Hezbollah over the past several weeks.

item.title: UK's Manchester Airport begins resuming operations after power outage
More African nations focus on HPV vaccination against cervical cancer, but hesitancy remains
Xi, Putin score wins as more Asia leaders aim to join BRICS
item.description: Thailand, a US treaty ally, recently announced its intention to join BRICS, a group consisting of Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa. For countries in Southeast Asia, joining BRICS is seen as a strategy to balance the economic risks from US-China competition. While these nations rely on trade with China, they also value the security and investment provided by the US. Additionally, BRICS membership signals growing frustration with the US-led international order and institutions dominated by Western powers, such as the World Bank and the IMF.

item.title: 'Joyous William vs gloomy Harry': Fans draw sharp contrasts between the two royals' concert experiences
item.description: Prince William's enthusiastic presence at Taylor Swift's concert, along with his children, sparks discussions on social media about the royal brothers' contrasting concert experiences. The event, attended by notable figures like Labour party leader Keir Starmer, showcases the significant economic impact of Swift's tour on London, adding another chapter to the ongoing analysis of the royal family's public personas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Arkansas nurse dies helping mass shooting victim
